matches.text: The tool appears to be Lovable (https://t.co/EIVRuWmTBl), an AI for building full apps from prompts. Per TechCrunch (Nov 2025), it's nearing 8M users with $100M ARR in 8 months. Forbes notes a rapid launch to $100M ARR. Valuation reached ~$1.8B after raising $200M soon after launch per LinkedIn reports. The post's exact stats ($2M ARR in 14 days, 700k users, $100M valuation in 8 weeks) aren't verified in sources and seem exaggerated, but the success is real.

Anything Max is the first AI software engineer that doesn't just write code.
It actually OPENS apps, clicks buttons, types in forms, and tests features like a real user would. https://t.co/1oDaBRDpOQ

Here's what makes it insane:
Most AI tools write code and hope it works. Max writes code, THEN uses the app to verify it actually works, THEN autonomously fixes what breaks.
It has eyes (sees the UI), hands (clicks/types), and a brain (runs for 30+ mins solo). https://t.co/4plxHcmLS4

The autonomous part is wild:
Founders can spin up 3 Max agents simultaneously. One building onboarding, another fixing checkout, a third adding team invites.
They all work in parallel for hours. Success rate on the hardest bugs: 97%+. https://t.co/9ilAci0Bot
